newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Gunmen kidnap family of three in Philippines.
newsitem.headline: Gunmen kidnap family of three in Philippines.

text.p: Ten gunmen seized a Filipino businessman, his wife and their three-year-old son on Tuesday on southern Mindanao island in the latest of a spate of kidnappings in the Philippines, police said.
The businessman, Weny Ballano, and his family were in a car when the gunmen flagged it down and abducted them in a village in Sultan Kudarat province.
The kidnappers escaped on a boat with their victims, leaving behind the car's driver, police said.

Despite repeated government pledges to crack down on kidnappers, crime gangs have abducted more than 100 people around the country this year, collecting 36.2 million pesos ($1.35 million) in ransom, according to police.
Thirty-seven of the kidnappings occurred in the Manila area, with the victims mostly members of wealthy Chinese families.
Police and soldiers have often been linked to the kidnappings, and Chinese community sources say they believe many of the gangs are protected by senior officers.
